column2: Designing the Forest Investment Program Strategy for Peru
column26: DESIGNING THE FOREST INVESTMENT PROGRAM STRATEGY FOR PERU
column27: The TCP will support the development of the Investment Strategy in Peru of the Forest Investment Program (FIP), including stakeholder consultations and planning sessions. The main purpose of the FIP is to support Peru's REDD-efforts, providing up-front bridge financing for readiness reforms and public and private investments identified through national REDD readiness strategy.

column2: Life W Conservation a Ecological Restoration of Atiquipa
column9: Finnish NGO Suomen lasten ja nuorten säätiö ry
column26: LIFE W CONSERVATION A ECOLOGICAL RESTORATION OF ATIQUIPA
column27: The project aims for the conservation, restoration and sustainable use of the Atiquipa Lomas. The project emcompasses following components: 1) biodiversity conservation, 2) water resources management and 3) climate change adaptation. Overall Objective is to conserve and recover native lomas forest in Atiquipa and ensure its conservation through active participation of local actors. The project aims to improve the capacity of the lomas to sustain livelihoods through strengthened organizational capacities at the local level for sustainable management of natural resources and adaptation to climate change.

column2: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
column9: Finnish NGO Suomen lasten ja nuorten säätiö ry
column26: LOCAL COOPERATION FUND (LCF) IN PERU
column27: Communal conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity at Pichis Valley. To alleviate poverty among indigenous communities by introducing the production of non wooden commercial items from communal forests outputs/ Eastern lowlands of Cerro de Pasco (Central Amazonia). This would be a continuation of a former one agreed as a complement to another Finnish funded project implemented by Conservation International, as a part of cooperation with DEVIDA (Peruvian national anti drug agency), on communal forest management as alternative development in contrast to illegal coca leaf plantations.

column2: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
column9: Finnish NGO Suomen lasten ja nuorten säätiö ry
column26: LOCAL COOPERATION FUND (LCF) IN PERU
column27: Regional Natural Reserve and Cordillera Azul National Park, through the promotion of sustainable management of two native palms for the production of vegetal ivory and brooms. The communities would be getting involved in the extraction of non wooden forestry products with good commercial demand, which would give them a source of incomes alternative to logging or deforesting for introducing livestock./ San Martin (North Eastern Amazonia).

column2: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
column9: Finnish NGO Suomen lasten ja nuorten säätiö ry
column26: LOCAL COOPERATION FUND (LCF) IN PERU
column27: Capacity building for the Ombudsman's office to be better prepared to mediate in environmental conflicts and supervise the proper enforcement of environmental norms/ Peru, whole country.Environmental conflicts are multiplying across the country as a consequence of past bad practices by private companies, mainly in the mining industry, but also as a consequence of the already present effects of climate change, like the growing scarcity of water. In many cases, it is a matter of lack of dialogue or inadequate channels for it between entrepreneurs and local people. The ombudsman's office has become a key actor for preventing conflicts as it is sometimes the only one that is trusted and respected by all parts.

column2: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
column9: Finnish NGO Suomen lasten ja nuorten säätiö ry
column26: LOCAL COOPERATION FUND (LCF) IN PERU
column27: Participative conservation and sustainable use of the orchid Phragmipedia kovachii, endemic species of San Martin region./ San Martin (North Western Amazonia). The project seeks to save the species from extinction and help to preserve the whole forest in the area (a natural reserve, legally protected but threatened in practice by extractive activities of surrounding population) through the sensitization of local people to get them involved at the conservation of the few last patch relicts of the orchid species in wilderness while offering to them the possibility of getting monetary incomes from eco tourism and in vitro cultivation of the endangered orchid.

column2: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
column9: Finnish NGO Suomen lasten ja nuorten säätiö ry
column26: LOCAL COOPERATION FUND (LCF) IN PERU
column27: Building and implementing a model for the sustainable management of Yanachaga Chemillén National Park with participation of local population. They want to integrate the local population in the administration of the park while helping them to get out of poverty through a rational and sustainable use of the natural resources of the park and its buffer zone. The project includes the design and implementation of managing tools and mechanisms of participation, training both the park staff and local leaders and the promotion of alternative sustainable economic activities among local population.

column2: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
column9: Finnish NGO Suomen lasten ja nuorten säätiö ry
column26: LOCAL COOPERATION FUND (LCF) IN PERU
column27: Training and campaining on environmental matters in the buffer zone of Pacaya Samiria National Reserve in Loreto, Northen Amazonia of Peru. Their main support will be local women with whom they have already been working. They will do several workshops at 8 native communities and 4 local schools and also produce an environmental radio programme to be broadcasted AT THEIR OWN COST, along the buffer zone of Pacaya Samiria National Reserve.

column2: Improving the sustainable control of natural resources and the protection of the ancient territory of the Quechua people in the basin of the Pastaza river, Perú. (2010 programs).
column26: IMPROVING THE SUSTAINABLE CONTROL OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND THE PROTECTION OF THE ANCIENT TERRITORY OF THE QUECHUA PEOPLE IN THE BASIN OF THE PASTAZA
column27: Mejorar el control del territorio y la fiscalización de los impactos de las actividades petroleras por parte de las comunidades Quechua de la Amazonia peruana y su federación representativa (Federación Indígena Quechua del Pastaza, FEDIQUEP) mediante el fomento de las capacidades locales. A través de implementar un sistema de monitorización indígena, procesos de fortalecimiento organizativo, acciones de incidencia, sensibilización y procesos legales, pretende buscar mayor transparencia y responsabilidad en las prácticas operacionales de la industria extractiva para asegurar la implementación real de los derechos indígenas y posibilitar su desarrollo sostenible.

column2: Program for the integrated territory development in the Angaraes province.
column25: Water supply assessments and studies|Irrigation|General environmental protection, activity unspecified (includes miscellaneous conservation and protection measures not mentioned below) or does not fit under any other applicable codes|Food crop production|Environmental impact assessments
column26: PROGRAM FOR THE INTEGRATED TERRITORY DEVELOPMENT IN THE ANGARAES PROVINCE.
column27: El Programa busca potenciar la gestión socio ambiental integrada, participativa, concertada y con equidad de género del territorio de las microcuencas de la provincia de Angaraes. La población destinataria, según el mapa de pobreza se ubica en el Quintil 1 - los más pobres - con ingreso por debajo de 30 euros/mes/familia, alto porcentaje de mujeres analfabetas, tasa de desnutrición infantil sobre el 50%, e IDH de los más críticos del Perú. Los beneficiarios directos son 13.645 habitantes, los indirectos 55.704. La propuesta se divide en 4 componentes: 1. La gobernabilidad ambiental para realizar la gestión territorial ordenada, planificada y concertada de las microcuencas que contribuya en la conservación y el aprovechamiento sostenible de los recursos naturales. Se incorporan estrategias de gestión integrada del medio ambiente, especialmente del agua como elemento central, en función al Plan de Ordenamiento Territorial y a nivel distrital implementando las acciones en función a los Planes de Gestión Ambiental. Para la sostenibilidad se propone la participación activa de las municipalidades a nivel provincial y distrital. A nivel de los actores se promueve la constitución de la Plataforma Social del Manejo Ambiental para promover la participación y vigilancia ambiental. 2. Agua para la producción con el objetivo de contribuir en la dinamización del proceso de desarrollo económico territorial a través de la gestión social de riego equitativa y enfocada a la mejora de la producción agropecuaria. La estrategia es el fortalecimiento de la organización de regantes para una mejor administración, mantenimiento y distribución del riego; a nivel de la infraestructura de riego, mejorar la eficiencia de conducción, distribución y aplicación del agua en las chacras (parcelas). A nivel familiar, promover el desarrollo de capacidades para el manejo eficiente de las chacras para no solo producir alimentos suficientes, sino comercializar el excedente. Así mismo, se contribuye en la diversificación productiva con promoción de cultivos andinos de alto valor nutritivo y hortalizas y en la parte media y baja con la producción de frutales. 3. Familias y comunidades saludables para disminuir los factores determinantes de enfermedades diarréicas y respiratorias agudas y parasitosis, que son responsables directas de la desnutrición. Se impulsa un mejor acceso al consumo de agua segura, manejo adecuado de residuos sólidos, manejo eficiente de efluentes líquidos - excretas con la construcción de baños ecológicos, sensibilización en la mejora de prácticas de higiene, alimentación balanceada y ordenamiento de las viviendas familiares con cocinas mejoradas para disminuir humos y el alto consumo de leña. Para asegurar la sostenibilidad se fortalecen los espacios de planificación y monitoreo de los servicios de salud y se fortalecen las organizaciones de usuarios de agua (JASS). 4. Fortalecimiento institucional que busca mejorar la gestión corporativa del desarrollo terri

column2: Environmental management and education in the Colca Valley.
column9: E.M.A-RTV. Association of Municipal and community radios of Radio-Television of Andalusia
column26: ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT AND EDUCATION IN THE COLCA VALLEY.
column27: El proyecto Gestión y Educación Ambiental pretende lograr una gestión ambiental eficaz, desarrollando sinergias con la promoción del turismo sostenible y las oportunidades económicas que brinda junto a la valoración de los recursos naturales de la zona de intervención, con el desarrollo del sector agropecuario mediante la oferta de productos naturales y orgánicos, con valor agregado y calidad. Esto permitirá generar empleo y mejorar los ingresos de los campesinos a través de una articulación directa con la industria del turismo en la zona. Se impulsará la gestión adecuada del saneamiento ambiental, mediante la promoción de la educación ambiental de la población en su conjunto, fortaleciendo las capacidades de las familias rurales para el reaprovechamiento de los residuos sólidos orgánicos e inorgánicos, ampliando el acceso a los servicios básicos de saneamiento e impulsará la institucionalización de normas y políticas hacia una gestión ambiental local sostenible.De esta manera, se consolidarán logros de intervenciones anteriores que apoyaron tanto la actividad ganadera como la agrícola, promocionaron los emprendimientos rurales, productivos y de servicios, formalizaron microempresas y sus productos, mejoraron las condiciones básicas sanitarias e incorporaron las experiencias e iniciativas locales en instrumentos de gestión en la Provincia de Caylloma, avanzando hacia el fortalecimiento de la institucionalidad para una gestión ambiental sostenible.

column2: Children skills for the lead of sustainable management in the basin of the Cumbaza River. Perú.
column26: CHILDREN SKILLS FOR THE LEAD OF SUSTAINABLE MANAGEMENT IN THE BASIN OF THE CUMBAZA RIVER. PERÚ.
column27: Se busca a través de acciones con niños y niñas promover cambios de actitud y conciencia en los pobladores principalmente en la cuenca del río Cumbaza, para la conservación, manejo y cuidado de los recursos naturales y el medio ambiente. Se asigna a cada niño 1 ha de tierra propiedad de la comunidad en la que construirán espacios naturales académicos y de investigación especialmente diseñados en función al sueño (visión) de los alumnos y al ecosistema de la cuenca.

column2: Improving health and environmental conditions of the community of Panpacangallo.
column26: IMPROVING HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS OF THE COMMUNITY OF PANPACANGALLO.
column27: Es objetivo específico del proyecto reducir los factores de riesgo que ocasionan la presencia de enfermedades infectocontagiosas y respiratorias en la comunidad, mejorando las condiciones de habitabilidad, promoviendo la gestión adecuada de residuos sólidos y el tratamiento sanitario del agua potable y residual, incorporando el cuidado ambiental, la educación sanitaria y planificación participativa de la gestión.Para ello se plantea la realización de las siguientes actividades:a)Generación de políticas públicas saludables para el manejo de residuos en la comunidad de Pampa Cangallo,b)Elaboración de un Plan de Acción para la recolección y manejo de residuos,c) Implementación de un centro de reciclaje municipal,d)cloración de reservorios de agua,e)Colocación de papeleras,f) Realización de talleres de capacitación sobre separación de residuos,g) Realización de concurso ?Instituciones educativas limpias y saludables?,h) Talleres de capacitación para la elaboración de materiales decorativos y utilitarios con materiales de reciclaje. Dirigido a docentes de instituciones edcuativas,i) Campañas comunicacionales para el cuidado del medio ambiente.(Spot radio, radioteatros...),j) Feria lúdica de sensibilización para el manejo adecuado de la basura en el distrito,k) Realización de pasantias a comunidades saludables, dirigidas a los docentes de las instituciones educativas,l) Realización de dos talleres de capacitación sobre la recolección segregada de residuos sólidos y su aprovechamiento,m) Recuperación de áreas degradadas para su uso como espacio de recreo y biohuertos,n) Realización de concurso ?calles limpias y libres de residuos sólidos?,o) Realización de talleres de uso y mantenimiento de servicios higiénicos,p) Taller de capacitación para la elaboración de juguetes con materiales reciclados,k) Asistencia técnica a las familias para la elaboración de compost, r)la implementación de espacios de recreación, biohuertos y actividades del proyecto,s) Construcción de lavaderos en domicilios y capacitación para su uso adecuado,t) Implementación de 80 cocinas mejoradas y u) Asistencia técnica, acompañamiento y administración del proyecto.La intervención contempla una metodología participativa, a través de talleres, reuniones, asambleas comunales, capacitaciones prácticas, asistencia técnica y campañas de sensibilización que impliquen a toda la población e instituciones. TADEPA es una institución privada sin fines de lucro creada en 1978, que desde sus inicios ha trabajado en Ayacucho, dedicada primordialmente a proyectos de desarrollo sostenibles a largo plazo. -- Geographical target area : El presente proyecto se ubica en Ayacucho, uno de los departamentos más pobres de Perú, concretamente en la provincia de Cangallo, en la comunidad campesina de Pampacangallo del distrito de Los Morochucos. --

column27: Promover prácticas de salud ambiental que mejoren las condiciones de vida de la población, así como una adecuada gestión de residuos y de contaminantes -- Geographical target area : Región Ica en la costa sur central del territorio peruano a 5 horas de la capital. Provincia de Pisco, una de las 5 provincias de la región. Distrito de Pisco a 5 minutos de la población urbana en la zona. --

column2: Improving a sustainable control of natural resources and protection of the ancestral land of the Quechua people in the basin of the Pastaza river.
column9: Alternative of exchange with indigenous people.
column26: IMPROVING A SUSTAINABLE CONTROL OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND PROTECTION OF THE ANCESTRAL LAND OF THE QUECHUA PEOPLE IN THE BASIN OF THE PASTAZA RIVER.
column27: El proyecto se localiza en un área de bosque tropical de la cuenca del río Pastaza, en la región de Loreto, en la Amazonia septentrional peruana fronteriza con Ecuador. Tiene como población destinataria a los quechua del Pastaza, una etnia que practica una economía de substistència y depende del bosque tropical y los ríos para la alimentación, la medicina, los recursos y la reproducción social y cultural como pueblo.

column27: Se pretende elaborar una publicación para la difusión de las tecnologías energéticas apropiadas para el desarrollo humano. Para ello se recogerán datos en terreno sobre proyectos ya implementados por distintas organizaciones con distintos tipos de tecnologías y, juntamente con la experiencia acumulada anteriormente con las ONGDs que participan en este proyecto, se redactará un manual que permita desarrollar actividades de incidencia política en el Sur, así como de sensbilización a la comunidad universitaria en el Norte.Se ha desarrollado el proyecto en colaboración con la organización Soluciones Prácticas.

column2: Making visible what s invisible. Promoting protection and awareness actions to guarantee the survival of the peoples isolated.
column25: Forestry development, activity unspecified or does not fit elsewhere in group|Fishery development, activity unspecified or does not fit elsewhere in this group|Agricultural services
column26: MAKING VISIBLE WHAT S INVISIBLE. PROMOTING PROTECTION AND AWARENESS ACTIONS TO GUARANTEE THE SURVIVAL OF THE PEOPLES ISOLATED.
column27: El proyecto pretende desarrollar diversas acciones de sensibilización y protección de los pueblos en aislamiento y contacto inicial en dos líneas de trabajo complementarias y necesarias entre si. Por un lado se pretende desarrollar una línea de trabajo dirigida a sensibilizar y generar conciencia sobre la necesidad de proteger a estos pueblos. Para ello se realizará un documental sobre las situaciones y problemas que sufren estos pueblos en la actualidad y posteriormente se realizará una campaña de difusión del documental en todos los países de la región, acompañada de charlas y debates con expertos y organizaciones indígenas para incidir más en el mensaje. Por otro lado se continuará con las acciones de protección de los pueblos en aislamiento y de sus territorios a través de la implementación de las directrices de Naciones Unidas para la protección de los pueblos en aislamiento y contacto inicial.

Además de brindar asesoramiento y apoyotécnico permanente a la población en temas ligados al patrimonio.Esta oficina (OGPC), estará integrada dentro de la estructura de AUTOCOLCA yAsesorada por la Municipalidad Provincial de Caylloma. Se compone básicamentepor cuatro áreas:Área técnica, Área Territorio y Medio Ambiente, Área de Documentación y el Área de Gestión Cultural

column2: Natural Resources and Biodiversity
column25: Macro-economic, fiscal and monetary policy and planning|Trade facilitation, activity unspecified or does not fit elsewhere in group|Improving public expenditure and financial management systems|Public sector financial management, activity unspecified or does not fit elsewhere in group|Industrial sector policy, planning and programmes|Modernization and rehabilitation
column26: NATURAL RESOURCES AND BIODIVERSITY
column27: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Objective, when applicable and appropriate. [through U.S. Government - U.S. Agency for International Development]

column2: Clean Productive Environment
column25: Biosphere protection, activity unspecified or does not fit elsewhere in group
column26: CLEAN PRODUCTIVE ENVIRONMENT
column27: Improve sustainability of a productive and clean environment by reducing risks to the health of the workforce and the population in general, communities, and ecosystems from environmental pollution and other environmental risks associated with industrial and agricultural production, urbanization, energy use, transport, and other human activity. [through U.S. Government - U.S. Agency for International Development]

column26: ADMINISTRATION AND OVERSIGHT - ASSISTANCE FOR HIV/AIDS - ASSISTANCE FOR HIV/AIDS
column27: PEPFAR: Supports the following illustrative program-funded costs: salaries of US, FSN, and TCN and other staff such as PSCs, RSSAs, PASAs, CASUs working for the US Government managing, administering, and supporting programs and their program-funded benefits such as housing, travel, transportation, education allowances etc; institutional contractors that provide such staff, rent, IT services, the program-funded share of utilities, staff training costs and the cost of developing and administering training programs, equipment and supplies, ICASS, vehicle fuel and maintenance, maintenance contracts, janitorial services, operational unit web page development and maintenance, outreach such as publications and the cost of their preparation (including staff costs), and technical assistance to ensure USG compliance with regulations. - Assistance for HIV/AIDS - Assistance for HIV/AIDS [through U.S. Government - U.S. Agency for International Development]

column2: Conservation Of Shorebirds & Coastal Wetlands At Bahia De Sechura
column26: CONSERVATION OF SHOREBIRDS & COASTAL WETLANDS AT BAHIA DE SECHURA
column27: NMBCA** - Project partners will implement a comprehensive plan for reserve expansion and implement on-the-ground management activities to protect wetland habitats particularly in the San Pedro Mangroves (3013 ha); and establish a monitoring program to include the WHSRN Site Assessment Tool, bird monitoring, and hydrologic monitoring.

column2: Conservation of Archeological Artifacts from the Royal Tombs of Sipan
column26: CONSERVATION OF ARCHEOLOGICAL ARTIFACTS FROM THE ROYAL TOMBS OF SIPAN
column27: To support the conservation of more than 900 archeological artifacts from the Royal Tombs of Sipan in Lambayeque. One of the most important pre-Columbian sites in Peru, the Royal Tombs of Sipan have had a major impact on the field of pre-Columbian archaeology and the study of Mochica culture. The project includes the documentation and conservation of artifacts and improvements to the display environment within the Sipan site museum.

column2: Capacity building for natural reserves? rangers and their professional guild
column26: CAPACITY BUILDING FOR NATURAL RESERVES? RANGERS AND THEIR PROFESSIONAL GUILD
column27: Specialized training for natural reserves? rangers and exchange of experiences among them as well as organizational consolidation of their professional association throughout a national congress of rangers. The training will include: guidelines to face climate change effects on their working areas; national policy for environmental education; sharing experiences on eradication of illicit crops; sharing experiences on eco tourism; biology as a tool for conservancy; management of natural reserves; patrolling and control of poaching and illegal logging.

column2: PERU/FLC Sustainable use of vegeyal ivory in 2 natural reserves phase 2
column26: PERU/FLC SUSTAINABLE USE OF VEGEYAL IVORY IN 2 NATURAL RESERVES PHASE 2
column27: Alleviating the deforestation pressure in the buffer zones of both Cordillera Escalera Regional Natural Reserve and Cordillera Azul National Park through the promotion of sustainable management of two native palms for the production of vegetal ivory and brooms. The communities are already involved in the extraction of non wooden forestry products with good commercial demand which will give them a source of incomes alternative to logging or deforesting for introducing livestock. This phase will allow them to start giving added value to their production/ San Martin (North Eastern Amazonia)

column2: PERU/FLC Conservación participativa de orquideas ? phase III
column26: PERU/FLC CONSERVACIÓN PARTICIPATIVA DE ORQUIDEAS ? PHASE III
column27: Participative conservation and sustainable use of the orchid Phragmipedia kovachii endemic species of Amazonas & San Martin regions (North Western Amazonia of Peru).Continuation of a former project seeking to save the species from extinction and help to preserve the whole forest in the area (a natural reserve threatened by extractive activities of surrounding population) through the involvement of local people by offering to them the possibility of getting monetary incomes from eco tourism and in vitro cultivation of the endangered orchid. This last support will allow them to implement the recommendations of a marketing study meant to assure the future sustainability of the new activities proposed to local people and to provide some additional equipment to the centre of interpretation and rangers' post for it to serve as lodging facility for future tourists and researchers.

column2: Consolidating an agro forestry initiative already implemented by local people in Madre de Dios
column26: CONSOLIDATING AN AGRO FORESTRY INITIATIVE ALREADY IMPLEMENTED BY LOCAL PEOPLE IN MADRE DE DIOS
column27: Consolidating an agro forestry initiative already implemented by local people enriching the plantations and introducing beekeeping as an additional source of incomes. The area is threatened by the advance of illegal gold mining and the goal of the project is to provide local people the required strength to confront it. They are including activities to assure commercial connections for assuring sustainability./ Madre de Dios (Southern Amazonia of Peru).

column2: The SABA Water and Sanitation Experience: Boosting Impact at Global Scale
column23: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation
column25: Energy sector policy, planning and programs|All formal sector financial intermediaries|Solar energy|Environmental policy, laws, regulations and economic instruments
column26: THE SABA WATER AND SANITATION EXPERIENCE: BOOSTING IMPACT AT GLOBAL SCALE
column27: For one of the first time in its history, SDC can exert important leverage effects – with little funding – upon nation-wide and international scaling up operations in Peru. The Global Program Water Initiatives decided to support this new generation of projects to demonstrate how SDC can generate added value and influence the global debate. The Peruvian authorities want to capitalize on SDC 15-year experience in rural water and sanitation in rural areas for boosting full national coverage of such services.This initiative is a new generation of projets required to respond: to the water & sanitation MDG’s water related targets and to the human right to access to water & sanitation.
column50: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

column2: Programa de Adaptación Climatico
column25: Micro-credit operations
column26: PROGRAMA DE ADAPTACIÓN CLIMATICO
column27: Le Programme d'Adaptation au Changement Climatique a comme finalité de Contribuer à consolider les conditions de vie des communautés dans les régions andines de Cusco et Apurimac en réduisant la vulnérabilité - surtout des couches sociales défavorisées - face aux conséquences du Changement Climatique. Les résultats attendus du PACC à l'horizon 2011-2012 sont au nombre de quatre: 1. Connaître la vulnérabilité - Les régions de Cusco et Apurimac ont développé des diagnostics et dressé la liste des conditions d'adaptation au Changement Climatique avec la participation des populations affectées, de leurs autorités et d'institutions spécialisées. 2. Mesurer et informer - Un système régional d'information publique sur le Changement Climatique et ses effets est établi et validé par les autorités. 3. Agir dans des districts choisis - Des mesures d'adaptation priorisées sont mises en œuvre dans des districts sélectionnés dans chacune des deux régions. 4. Apprendre et influencer les politiques publiques - Le thème de l'adaptation au Changement Climatique est bien présent dans les politiques publiques, aux trois niveaux : pays, régions et municipalités rurales, en s'inspirent des expériences générées par le PACC.
column61: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank

Apprendre et influencer les politiques publiques - Le thème de l'adaptation au Changement Climatique est bien présent dans les politiques publiques, aux trois niveaux : pays, régions et municipalités rurales, en s'inspirent des expériences générées par le PACC.

column2: Scaling-up Rural Innovations (Peru)
column9: Centro de AnÃ¡lisis y DifusiÃ³n de la EconomÃ­a Paraguaya
column25: Food crop production|Environmental policy, laws, regulations and economic instruments
column26: SCALING-UP RURAL INNOVATIONS (PERU)
column27: Confronted with changing environments and growing poverty and inequalities, many small-scale farmers from the Andes have been forced to adopt innovative livelihood strategies. They have done this by combining practical knowledge, local talent and external assets to manage their natural resources in creative and novel ways - ways that result in increased food and income security, and allow them to escape from poverty. This project will explore ways of stimulating and scaling up the innovations of small-scale farmers. In collaboration with stakeholders, researchers will examine instances of scaled-up innovation in farm production, natural resource management and off-farm income generation and develop policies and programs in consequence. The project will focus initially on Peru and be extended to other Andean countries, and potentially Africa.

column27: The International Forest Carbon Initiative (IFCI) is an initiative jointly managed by AusAID and the Department of Climate Change and Energy Efficiency which purpose is to support global efforts to reduce carbon emissions from deforestation. column2: Caritas Australia ANCP Partnership
column9: University college or other teaching institute
column25: Women in development, activity unspecified or does not fit elsewhere in group|Support for vulnerable groups|Support to non-governmental organizations and government organizations, activity unspecified or does not fit under any other applicable codes|Support to prevent the recruitment of child soldiers|General environmental protection, activity unspecified (includes miscellaneous conservation and protection measures not mentioned below) or does not fit under any other applicable codes|Food security programs|Women's equality organisations and institutions|Food aid/Food security programmes, activity unspecified
column26: CARITAS AUSTRALIA ANCP PARTNERSHIP
column27: The AusAID-Non-Government Organisations (NGOs) Cooperation Program (ANCP) is a long-running program that subsidises the overseas development activities of accredited Australian NGOs. Through the ANCP, AusAID supports accredited Australian NGOs to implement their own international development programs. This initiative specifically provides funding to 'Partnership' NGOs. Under the Partnership agreements, AusAID and the partnership NGOs are working more strategically on addressing issues such as child protection, gender, food security and climate change to accelerate the joint efforts of both government and non-government organisations to help reach the Millennium Development Goals. The ANCP also aims to enhance NGO effectiveness and accountability through a well-developed accreditation and reporting system, and to promote innovation in the sector through the ANCP Innovations Fund. The total value of the program for all countries is $440 million over 6 years, starting 2009-10.

column2: Territory and natural resources management in the Peru border (second part).
column26: TERRITORY AND NATURAL RESOURCES MANAGEMENT IN THE PERU BORDER (SECOND PART).
column27: Gestión del territorio y de los recursos naturales en la frontera del Perú ( 2ª parte) :: El proyecto persigue aportar a la gobernabilidad democrática y a la construcción de alternativas endógenas y sostenibles de desarrollo fortaleciendo las capacidades de los actores locales y regionales de la frontera entre el Perú y el Ecuador en el área de influencia de las actividades y concesiones mineras. El proyecto centra sus actividades en la construcción participativa de instrumentos para la prevención y transformación de conflictos socioambientales, en la impartición de ciclos formativos para autoridades y líderes locales, elaboración de planes de acción, construcción de infraestructuras básicas ( local de reuniones) , diseño e impulso de campañas de sensibilización e información, realización de diagnósticos técnicos y constitución de organismos locales de participación.

column2: Renforcement des capacit?s d'incidence de la soci?t? civile en mati?re de pr?vention et de mitigation des impacts sociaux et environnementaux provenant des m?ga-investissements situ?s en Amazonie, particuli?rement ? Madre de Dios et Puno
column26: RENFORCEMENT DES CAPACIT?S D'INCIDENCE DE LA SOCI?T? CIVILE EN MATI?RE DE PR?VENTION ET DE MITIGATION DES IMPACTS SOCIAUX ET ENVIRONNEMENTAUX PROVENA
column27: ?Lieu d?intervention : national, cibl? sur les r?gions de Madre de Dios et Puno -Les groupes de travail de Madre de Dios et Puno;-Secteurs du pouvoir qui prennent les d?cisions politiques (Parlement, Gouvernements r?gionaux et locaux) ;-OSC (ONGs, universit?s, consommateurs, m?dias et secteur priv?) ;-Population rurale de Madr Les politiques publiques associ?es aux m?ga-investissements de l?Amazonie sud du P?rou tiennent compte des aspects sociaux et environnementaux, outre les aspects ?conomiques. De m?me, elles favorisent la promotion du bien-?tre de la population affect?e la plus d?favoris?e, en mettant l?accent sur la pr?vention, la mitigation et la compensation des impacts socio environnementaux qui pourraient se pr?senter. Les Groupes de travail de la soci?t? civile de Madre de Dios et Puno ont renforc?s leurs capacit?s d?incidence politique concernant la promotion ou l?impl?mentation des m?ga-investissements qui affectent le d?veloppement social et environnemental des r?gions mentionn?es. R?sultat 1 : La soci?t? civile de Madre de Dios et Puno dispose d?information syst?matis?e et pertinente concernant les m?ga-investissements.R?sultat 2 : Les Groupes de travail de Madre de Dios et Puno am?liorent leurs capacit?s d??laborer des propositions techniques li?es aux m?ga-investissements, pour influencer les politiques publiques. R?sultat 3:Les Groupes de travail de Madre de Dios et Puno am?liorent l?efficacit? et la capacit? de r?ponse avec lesquelles ils interviennent sur les politiques publiques li?es aux m?ga-investissements. R?sultat 4:Les Groupes de travail de Madre de Dios et Puno promeuvent des espaces d?interlocution soci?t? civile ? Etat au niveau r?gional et national.

column2: D?veloppement economique durable et gestion strat?gique des ressources naturelles dans les r?gions de Apur?mac, Ayacucho, Huancavelica, Jun?n et Pasco
column9: NGO Le Monde selon les femmes
column26: D?VELOPPEMENT ECONOMIQUE DURABLE ET GESTION STRAT?GIQUE DES RESSOURCES NATURELLES DANS LES R?GIONS DE APUR?MAC, AYACUCHO, HUANCAVELICA, JUN?N ET PASC
column27: The promotion of a sustainable use of the natural resources in de regions of Apur?mac, Ayacucho, Huancavelica, Jun?n and Pasco is the principal target of this intervention En las zonas de intervenci?n, el Programa permitir˜ el uso adecuado y sostenible de los recursos naturales (renovables y no renovables), lo que contribuir˜ a la reducci?n de la pobreza y a la preservaci?n del patrimonio natural (conservaci?n de la biodiversidad, recursos h?dricos sostenibles y alto a la deforestaci?n). Adem˜s, la mejora de la producci?n agr?cola orientada al mercado local, junto con la participaci?n positiva de las mujeres, promover˜n la seguridad alimentaria y contribuir˜n a reducir la malnutrici?n. Los beneficiarios est˜n constituidos por pobladores pobres y pobres extremos de las Regiones de Apur?mac, Ayacucho, Huancavelica, Jun?n y Pasco. Son 531.783 personas en total Nivel de pobreza de los hombres y mujeres de las regiones considerados en el ˜mbito del Programa reducido aprovechando en forma ordenada los recursos naturales y tomando en cuenta las necesidades de las generaciones futuras. Al 2015, los recursos naturales en el ˜mbito de influencia del Programa son identificados, valorizados, conservados y utilizados de manera sostenible de acuerdo a una planificaci?n a largo plazo y con una mayor productividad, competitividad y acceso a mercados para los hombres y mujeres que inicialmente viv?an en pobreza y extrema pobreza.

Adem˜s, en las regiones, ciertos grupos de que ser˜n parte de un proyecto piloto ser˜n tambi?n incluidos en los beneficiarios directos.Beneficiarios indirectos: Las poblaciones en pobreza y en pobreza extrema en el ˜mbito de la cuenca del r?o pampas, que comprende a los departamentos de Huancavelica, Ayacucho y Apurimac La calidad de vida de las poblaciones beneficiarias ha mejorado a trav?s de la conservaci?n y el aprovechiamento sostenible del patrimonio natural Las capacidades a nivel nacional y regional est˜n fortalecidas para el desarrollo estrat?gico y puesta en valor del patrimonio natural

column2: Duurzaam beheer ter bescherming van het Nationaal Park Yanachaga Chemill?n met medewerking van het Beheerscomit? en de bevolking van de bufferzone.
column26: DUURZAAM BEHEER TER BESCHERMING VAN HET NATIONAAL PARK YANACHAGA CHEMILL?N MET MEDEWERKING VAN HET BEHEERSCOMIT? EN DE BEVOLKING VAN DE BUFFERZONE.
column27: https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B-IUzKYaN-QScEp6TFIxSXRzaTg/edit?usp=sharing This project aims at ensuring the protection of the National Park Yanachaga Chemill?n and the sustainable development of families in the buffer zone. It starts with the development of an active and participative management plan of the park, coordinated by the managing organization DRIS (Desarrollo Rural Integral Sustentable). An important assumption is that conservation should be part of a collective consensus en should not be an obligation. Therefor activities are planned concerning the following topics: environment, biodiversity protection and sustainable management of natural resources. The strategy to attain protection and sustainable management is to strengthen the capacities of the direction and administration of the park, together with the management committee and the civil society, through the collective elaboration of projects and productive activities for socio-economic development. The project aims at consolidating an inclusive model for the management of protected areas that allows actors of the civil society and families in the buffer zone to be actively involved in the management of the National Park.

column2: Mod?le d'am?nagement forestier durable et de bois certifi? par les communaut?s indig?nes Shipibo Konibo
column26: MOD?LE D'AM?NAGEMENT FORESTIER DURABLE ET DE BOIS CERTIFI? PAR LES COMMUNAUT?S INDIG?NES SHIPIBO KONIBO
column27: https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B-IUzKYaN-QSQkJ6S2RFX3lCMmc/edit?usp=sharing This project will be implemented in certified indigenous communities in the districts of Masisea and Ipar?a in the province of Coronel Portillo in the Ucayali region, Peru, from January 2011 to June 2012. The project aims to help preserve tropical community forests and improve the quality of life of the indigenous communities in the Ucayali region. It will do so through the sustainable production of the resources available in their community forests in the current context of globalisation and trading economy and by allowing the quality and quantity of the sustainable production of woody forest products to increase in certified community forests of three communities by reinforcing the knowledge and techniques of sustainable exploitation and production of wood products in the quantity and quality required by the certified wood market. In order to give the proposal a sustainable character, a company vision and permanent technical assistance are used.

column2: Conservation de la biodiversit? et gestion durable des ressources naturelles dans la r?gion de l'Alto Putumayo
column26: CONSERVATION DE LA BIODIVERSIT? ET GESTION DURABLE DES RESSOURCES NATURELLES DANS LA R?GION DE L'ALTO PUTUMAYO
column27: https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B-IUzKYaN-QST0RLZGRJa1VXSnM/edit?usp=sharing The specific aim of this project is to encourage local Secoya and Kichwa communities to choose a sustainable development model, in view of biodiversity conservation and the sustainable management of the natural resources of the exceptional ecosystem in the Alto Putumayo area. To this end, investments are above all made in building capacity and knowledge around the following themes: internal organisation and strong leadership, administration, status management, drafting of internal regulations, communication, situation of categorisation process ZRG, the preparation of co-management of Reservas Comunales, sustainable management of natural resources and monitoring of territories (in cooperation with ICCA), eco-system services, indigenous rights and rights regarding the extraction of natural resources, and the situation of oil blocks 117A and B, and 187. Secondly, the communities are supported by APP in defending their rights through legal actions and lobbying. APP also supports indigenous federations in obtaining and maintaining their legal status.

column9: ONUSIDA - Programa Conjunto de las Naciones Unidas sobre el VIH/SIDA
column26: OWN PROGRAM: TRAINEESHIP: AFFORESTATION AND REFORESTATION PROJECT AS A WAY TO MITIGATE THE CLIMATIC CHANGE IN CUZCO, PERU.
column27: La situación actual en la Cuenca del Vilcanota de la Región Cusco, presenta gran cantidad de zonas con aptitud forestal, desprovistas de vegetación.Se define como PROBLEMA CENTRAL, la Degradación de los sistemas forestales para la protección y conservación de los ecosistemas la Región Cusco. Se considera originado por las siguientes causas:Causas directas • Deficiente manejo forestal.• Deficiente gestión en el manejo de recursos forestales.Causas Indirectas • Escasa disponibilidad de especies forestales e inadecuado uso de suelos. • Deficiente conocimiento técnico en el manejo sostenible de los recursos forestales.• Débil capacidad de organización, gestión y liderazgo para el manejo de recursos forestales. • Limitadas herramientas de monitoreo para la conservación de recursos forestales.El Objetivo Central es la Recuperación de Sistemas Forestales para la Protección y Conservación de los ecosistemas correspondientes en las Provincias Intervenidas de la Región de Cusco, y como medida de mitigación al cambio climático. --- original channelcode : 51001

column2: Impacts of Climate Variability and Climate Change on the Mangrove Ecosystem in Tumbes, Peru
column26: IMPACTS OF CLIMATE VARIABILITY AND CLIMATE CHANGE ON THE MANGROVE ECOSYSTEM IN TUMBES, PERU
column27: The mangrove ecosystem of Tumbes plays a pivotal role in providing protection against tides, winds and storm surges, and habitat for a number of fish species. The native coastal communities of Tumbes rely on artisanal fishing for food and income generation. Already under threat from water pollution, deforestation and overfishing (black conch), climate change is affecting the stability and health of the mangrove ecosystem through increased sea level rise and variable rainfall. For example, reduced water flows during the dry season increase the salinity of the mangrove waters, while intense precipitation during the rainy season dilutes saline waters and increases sediment loads. Sustainable management of mangrove ecosystems is currently compromised by lack of basic scientific information.This project aims to improve understanding of the ecosystem so that its human population can prepare effectively for the impacts of climate variability. Researchers, in cooperation with community associations, local authorities and other stakeholders, will document the impact of climate variability on the ecology and sustainability of the mangrove ecosystem, investigate the sensitivity of the black conch (Andara tuberculosa) and other species to changing salinity and sediment levels, and assess the economic value of environmental services provided by the mangrove ecosystem.The project is expected to lead to the development of an adaptation plan for the mangrove ecosystem and local communities, including a concerted sustainable management plan for the extraction of the black conch. Given the importance of mangrove ecosystems to coastal areas throughout the world, this research has the potential to make a contribution to adaptation efforts by coastal communities beyond Peru.

column2: International Barcode of Life Project : Engaging Developing Nations
column26: INTERNATIONAL BARCODE OF LIFE PROJECT : ENGAGING DEVELOPING NATIONS
column27: DNA barcoding is a new tool for taxonomic research. The DNA barcode is a very short standardized DNA sequence in a well-known gene. It provides a secure and less complicated way of identifying the species to which an animal, plant or fungus belongs than traditional observation. The barcoding tool was developed by Dr Paul Hebert from the University of Guelph, which houses the International Barcode of Life (iBOL) project that champions barcoding. iBOL's mission is to extend the barcode reference library, provide community access to these records, and create new devices to ensure rapid bio-surveillance.Barcoding has numerous potential applications in, for example, resources conservation, disease prevention, detection of invasive species, water quality control, monitoring disease vectors, identification of illegally traded plants or animals, and the elimination of weed seeds in seed collections. To date, most of the barcoding research has been basic research carried out in Canada and in a limited number of other countries, primarily in the North. But, there is growing interest in barcoding on the part of diverse countries from around the world, as demonstrated at the Third International Barcode of Life conference held in Mexico, November 2009.This project will allow iBOL to expand the application of barcoding to developing countries. This will involve establishing barcode libraries in Argentina and South Africa to act as regional nodes within iBOL, establishing national nodes in three developing countries (Costa Rica, Kenya, Peru) and funding one project that uses DNA barcoding to address an important concern in ecosystem management in each of the five countries. The project will also allow iBOL to develop appropriate guidelines for dealing with issues of access and benefit sharing (ABS) that arise from the use of barcoding, to build scientific capacity in developing countries, and to establish an international network to foster dialogue between researchers and research funding organizations to promote and sustain international collaborative barcoding science.
column61: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank

column2: Scaling-up Rural Innovations (Peru)
column25: Food crop production|Environmental policy, laws, regulations and economic instruments
column26: SCALING-UP RURAL INNOVATIONS (PERU)
column27: Confronted with changing environments and growing poverty and inequalities, many small-scale farmers from the Andes have been forced to adopt innovative livelihood strategies. They have done this by combining practical knowledge, local talent and external assets to manage their natural resources in creative and novel ways - ways that result in increased food and income security, and allow them to escape from poverty. This project will explore ways of stimulating and scaling up the innovations of small-scale farmers. In collaboration with stakeholders, researchers will examine instances of scaled-up innovation in farm production, natural resource management and off-farm income generation and develop policies and programs in consequence. The project will focus initially on Peru and be extended to other Andean countries, and potentially Africa.

column2: Scaling-up Rural Innovations (Peru)
column25: Food crop production|Environmental policy, laws, regulations and economic instruments
column26: SCALING-UP RURAL INNOVATIONS (PERU)
column27: Confronted with changing environments and growing poverty and inequalities, many small-scale farmers from the Andes have been forced to adopt innovative livelihood strategies. They have done this by combining practical knowledge, local talent and external assets to manage their natural resources in creative and novel ways - ways that result in increased food and income security, and allow them to escape from poverty. column2: Prevention of Conflicts Over the Use of Natural Resources / Prévention des conflits liés à l'utilisation des ressources naturelles
column26: PREVENTION OF CONFLICTS OVER THE USE OF NATURAL RESOURCES / PRÉVENTION DES CONFLITS LIÉS À L'UTILISATION DES RESSOURCES NATURELLES
column27: The goal of this project is to help the Peruvian government, state agencies, civil society, and the private sector prevent, manage, and resolve conflicts relating to natural resources and economic growth. The project aims to contribute to creating and maintaining a stable economic environment for equitable and sustainable economic growth in Peru by reducing the economic and social impact of these conflicts. The project consists primarily of technical assistance to state agencies, especially the Presidencia del Consejo de Ministros (similar to Canada's Privy Council Office) and regional governments, to help them develop and implement policies, practices, and programs to prevent, manage, and resolve resource-based conflicts. Project activities include: training and capacity development of over 1,000 public officials, and other stakeholders, in conflict management and prevention; creation and implementation of tools to address conflicts, and to reach mutually agreeable agreements; support for the creation and operation of regional conflict management offices; and, support for the creation and operation of multi-sector dialogue tables at national, regional and local levels for the construction of an inclusive natural resource development agenda / Ce projet vise à appuyer le Gouvernement péruvien, les institutions publiques, la société civile et le secteur privé à prévenir, gérer et résoudre les conflits liés à l'utilisation des ressources naturelles et la croisssance économique. Le projet s'adresse à contribuer à la création et au maintien d'un environnement économique stable pour le développement économique équitable et durable du Pérou en réduisant l'impact socio-économique de ces conflits. Le projet fournit essentiellement de l'assistance technique, en particulier à la ''Presidencia del Consejo de Ministros'' (l'équivalent péruvien du Bureau du Conseil Privé du Canada) et les gouvernements régionaux dans le but de les appuyer à développer et mettre en place des politiques, des pratiques et des programmes pour la prévention, la gestion et la résolution de conflits liés à l'utilisation des ressources naturelles. Les activités du projet visent plus particulièrement à: la formation et le développement des capacités de plus de 1 000 fonctionnaires et d'autres acteurs clés en ce qui est de la gestion et la prévention de conflits; la création et la mise en place d'outils pour régler les conflits et parvenir à des accords mutuellement acceptables; le soutien à la création et au fonctionnement de bureaux régionaux de gestion de conflits; et, le soutien à la création et à la mise en place de rencontres (tables rondes) multi-sectorielles aux niveaux national, régional et local pour la construction d'un agenda visant au développement des ressources naturelles de façon inclusive

column2: Canadian Lutheran World Relief - Program 2008-2013 / Canadian Lutheran World Relief - Programme 2008-2013
column26: CANADIAN LUTHERAN WORLD RELIEF - PROGRAM 2008-2013 / CANADIAN LUTHERAN WORLD RELIEF - PROGRAMME 2008-2013
column27: The Canadian Lutheran World Relief (CLWR) program focuses on enabling women and men in disadvantaged communities to secure their rights and achieve greater control over their lives and livelihoods. It facilitates their participation in sustainable development activities, thereby empowering them to enhance their quality of life through sustainable livelihoods and increased human security. The program has three strategic objectives: (1) to strengthen just and democratic civil society and local government; (2) to support poverty reduction by building healthy, vibrant communities; and (3) to enhance gender equity programming and practices. CLWR works in partnership with the Lutheran World Federation in India, Mozambique, and Zambia; with Polytechnical Institute Tomas Katari - IPTK, Farmers Development Program - PRODEC, and Arado Foundation in Bolivia; and with Diaconia, Urpichally, and Comuniciones Aliadas in Peru. / Le programme du Canadian Lutheran World Relief (CLWR) met l'accent sur l'habilitation des femmes et des hommes dans les collectivités défavorisées afin qu'ils puissent affirmer leurs droits et avoir un plus grand contrôle sur leur vie et leurs moyens de subsistance. Pour ce faire, le programme facilite leur participation à des activités de développement durable, ce qui leur donne les moyens d'améliorer leur qualité de vie grâce à des moyens de subsistance viables et une sécurité humaine accrue. Le programme compte trois objectifs stratégiques : 1) renforcer une société civile et une administration locale justes et démocratiques; 2) oeuvrer à la réduction de la pauvreté par la création de collectivités dynamiques et saines; 3) améliorer les programmes et les pratiques qui prônent l'égalité entre les sexes. CLWR collabore avec le Lutheran World Federation en Inde, au Mozambique et en Zambie; avec l'Institut polytechnique Tomas Katari (IPTK), le PRODEC (Programme de développement des agriculteurs) et la Fondation Arado en Bolivie; avec Diaconia, Urpichally et Comuniciones Aliadas au Pérou.

column2: Cuso International - International Internships 2013-2014 / Cuso International - Stages internationaux 2013-2014
column26: CUSO INTERNATIONAL - INTERNATIONAL INTERNSHIPS 2013-2014 / CUSO INTERNATIONAL - STAGES INTERNATIONAUX 2013-2014
column27: This project is part of CIDA's International Youth Internship Program (IYIP), funded by the Government of Canada's Youth Employment Strategy (YES). The IYIP contributes to the YES by providing a large spectrum of Canadian graduates with valuable international development work experience abroad. Ce projet fait partie du programme de stages internationaux pour les jeunes (PSIJ) de l'ACDI, programme financé par la Stratégie emploi jeunesse (SEJ) du gouvernement du Canada. Le PSIJ contribue au SEJ en fournissant à un large éventail de jeunes diplômé(e)s canadien(ne)s une enrichissante expérience de travail à l'étranger en développement international.

column2: SUCO - Volunteer Sending 2009-2015 / SUCO - Envoi de volontaires 2009-2015
column26: SUCO - VOLUNTEER SENDING 2009-2015 / SUCO - ENVOI DE VOLONTAIRES 2009-2015
column27: The program concentrates its activities in three sectors: private sector development through partners' institutional and organizational strengthening; good governance through local development; and promotion of environmental sustainability through agriculture, forestry, fish and cattle farming systems. Every year, 22 volunteers support these efforts. The objectives of the program are: (1) help partners gain knowledge and adopt development practices that are democratic, just and sustainable; (2) help partners improve individual and collective well-being through socio-economic activities; (3) promote gender equity and empower women in gaining autonomy and influence; (4) support partners in their actions and practices leading towards viable and sustainable environmental development; and (5) promote openness for exchange and dialogue between development partners (government authorities and civil society organizations). An amount of $80,622 has been added to the total amount for each of the Volunteer Cooperation Agency programs for CIDA-led program evaluations. / Le programme concentre ses actions dans trois secteurs, soit le soutien au développement du secteur privé par le renforcement institutionnel et organisationnel de partenaires, la promotion de la bonne gouvernance par le développement local et la promotion de la durabilité de l'environnement par des systèmes agro-sylvo-pastoraux et piscicoles. Il y a 22 volontaires par année qui appuient ces efforts. Les objectifs du programme visent à 1) appuyer les partenaires à acquérir et adopter des pratiques de développement démocratique, équitable et durable; 2) soutenir les partenaires dans des actions socio-économiques permettant d'améliorer le mieux-être individuel et collectif des populations visées; 3) contribuer à la promotion de l'égalité entre les femmes et les hommes et soutenir les femmes dans l'atteinte d'une plus grande autonomie d'action et d'une plus grande influence; 4) soutenir les partenaires dans leurs actions et pratiques menant à un développement environnemental viable et durable; 5) favoriser la création d'espaces d'échanges et de dialogues entre partenaires du développement (instances gouvernementales et organisations de la société civile). Un montant de $ 80 622 a été ajouté au montant total pour chaque programme des organisations de coopération volontaire, pour les évaluations de programmes menées par l’ACDI.

column2: Oxfam-Québec - Volunteer Sending 2009-2015 / Oxfam-Québec - Envoi de volontaires 2009-2015
column26: OXFAM-QUÉBEC - VOLUNTEER SENDING 2009-2015 / OXFAM-QUÉBEC - ENVOI DE VOLONTAIRES 2009-2015
column27: This volunteer sending program is designed to send 636 volunteers to 13 developing countries. It aims to: (1) enable partners to provide women and men with the capacity to exercise their economic rights and to reduce their vulnerability to change; (2) enable civil society to establish effective dialogues with the government to identify policies and strategies that benefit vulnerable populations regarding the issues linked to essential health, education and drinking water services; (3) enable partners to strengthen women’s leadership and increase their capacity to influence, to identify strategies that eliminate all forms of violence and discrimination towards them, to ensure the defence and the promotion of their rights, and to involve men in this regard; and (4) enable partners to better defend youth issues in local policies, to promote access to essential education and health services for youth, and make youth stakeholders in society. As of the final year of the program, in April 2014, programming will extend to Colombia and Mali in the form of a regional approach. An amount of $80,622 has been added to the total amount for each of the Volunteer Cooperation Agency programs for CIDA-led program evaluations. / Ce programme d'envoi de volontaires permet l'envoi de 636 volontaires dans 13 pays en voie de développement. Il vise à : 1) habiliter les partenaires afin de donner aux femmes et aux hommes les capacités d'exercer leurs droits économiques et à réduire leur vulnérabilité face aux changements; 2) habiliter la société civile afin qu'elle soit en mesure d'établir un dialogue efficace avec le gouvernement afin d'identifier des politiques et stratégies en faveur des populations vulnérables sur les questions touchant les services essentiels en matière de santé, d'éducation et d'eau potable; 3) habiliter les partenaires afin de renforcer le leadership des femmes et d'accroître leur capacité d'influence, d'identifier des stratégies pour éliminer toute forme de violence et de discrimination à leur égard, d'assurer la défense et la promotion de leurs droits et d'impliquer les hommes dans cette démarche; 4) habiliter les partenaires afin qu'ils soient en mesure de mieux défendre la position des jeunes face aux politiques locales, de favoriser l'accès des jeunes à des services essentiels d'éducation et de santé et d'en faire des acteurs de la société. Lors de la dernière année du programme, à compter d’avril 2014, la Colombie et le Mali feront leur entrée dans la programmation dans une approche régionale. Un montant de 80 622 $ a été ajouté au montant total pour chaque programme des organisations de coopération volontaire pour les évaluations de programmes menées par l’ACDI.

column2: Strengthening Natural Resource Management / Renforcer la gestion des ressources naturelles
column9: Consorcio de Investigacion Economica y Social
column26: STRENGTHENING NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT / RENFORCER LA GESTION DES RESSOURCES NATURELLES
column27: This project aims to strengthen natural resource management and improve the way in which environmental policy is implemented in five regional governments in Peru (Piura, La Libertad, Loreto, Arequipa, and Cusco) and in key agencies within the central government. The project seeks to do this by training and coaching, research and policy development, and by creating linkages and knowledge sharing opportunities (such as internships, conferences, and working groups) among key stakeholders and experts in the private, public, civil society, and academic sectors. / Ce projet vise à renforcer la gestion des ressources naturelles et améliorer la mise en œuvre de politiques environnementales au sein de cinq gouvernements régionaux au Pérou (Piura, La Libertad, Loreto, Arequipa et Cusco) ainsi qu'au sein d'agences clés du gouvernement central. Le projet vise à accomplir cela par l'entremise d'activités de formation et de coaching, des recherches et l'élaboration de politiques, ainsi que la création de liens et de possibilités de partage de connaissances (tels que des stages, des conférences et des groupes de travail) parmi les principaux acteurs et experts du secteur privé, du secteur public, de la société civil et du secteur académique.

column2: Cuso International - Volunteer Sending 2009-2015 / Cuso International - Envoi de volontaires 2009-2015
column26: CUSO INTERNATIONAL - VOLUNTEER SENDING 2009-2015 / CUSO INTERNATIONAL - ENVOI DE VOLONTAIRES 2009-2015
column27: As part of the 2009-2015 Volunteer Cooperation Program, Cuso International places 1400 sector-focused skilled volunteers to build the capacity of partner organizations in 26 countries. Volunteer placements are both long- and short-term in nature, and include multiple types of volunteering options: North-South, South-South, South-North, national, Diaspora and business partnerships. Volunteers focus on capacity building (through sharing of knowledge, methodologies, and/or tools relating to specific capacity areas) and enhancing the ability of partners to influence development policy. Partners include local civil society organizations, national and local governments and various networks and associations. Cuso International also delivers a public engagement program in Canada designed to deepen understanding amongst Canadians and create opportunities for informed action on international development issues. Cuso International works in the following sectors: Education, with a particular focus on the inclusion of women and girls in educational options; HIV and AIDS, with a particular focus on the vulnerability of woman and girls, and the rights of people to have access to services; Participation and Governance / Access to Justice, by aiming to empower poor and marginalized groups, especially women, to fulfill rights of access to basic services, and by ensuring access to justice for women and children; Youth Social and Economic Inclusion, by creating opportunities for training and employment for young women and men facing poverty, underemployment and social exclusion; Protecting Environments; Managing Natural Resources, by strengthening community-level governance mechanisms, including the participation of women in community decision-making, aimed at better local management of natural resources; Gender Equality, by incorporating GE as a crosscutting theme throughout all programming components, and through local GE capacity building activities with partners. An amount of $80,622 has been added to the total amount for each of the Volunteer Cooperation Agency programs for CIDA-led program evaluations. / Dans le cadre du Programme de coopération volontaire 2009-2015, Cuso International place 1 400 volontaires compétents dans des secteurs ciblés afin de développer la capacité des organisations partenaires dans 26 pays. Les postes volontaires sont à la fois à court terme et à long terme et offrent de multiples options de volontariat : partenariats Nord-Sud, Sud-Sud, Sud-Nord, nationaux, de diaspora et d’affaires. Les volontaires se concentrent sur le développement des capacités par l’entremise du partage des connaissances, des méthodologies, ou des outils liés à des domaines particuliers en matière de capacité. Ils se concentrent également sur le rehaussement de la capacité des partenaires à influencer les politiques de développement. Les partenaires comprennent des organisations locales de la société civile, des gouvernements locaux et divers réseaux et ass

column9: Jeunesse Canada Monde / Canada World Youth
column26: CANADA WORLD YOUTH - VOLUNTEER SENDING 2009-2015 / JEUNESSE CANADA MONDE - ENVOI DE VOLONTAIRES 2009-2015
column27: This volunteer sending program supports the assignment of 3,931 Canadian and developing-country volunteers with partner organizations in developing countries. The program aims to support partner organizations working on health and environment-related initiatives through projects in the following sectors: (1) primary health care; (2) family planning and reproductive health care; (3) food and nutrition; (4) environmental conservation, pollution prevention, and capacity building in environmental management; and (5) equality between women and men. The program also includes a public engagement component that furthers the promotion of development awareness in Canada. An amount of $80,622 has been added to the total amount for each of the Volunteer Cooperation Agency programs for CIDA-led program evaluations. / Ce programme d’envoi de volontaires soutient la mission de 3 931 bénévoles Canadiens et ceux provenant des pays en développement, en collaboration avec les organisations partenaires dans les pays en développement. Le programme vise à soutenir les organisations partenaires qui travaillent dans des initiatives liées à la santé et à l’environnement dans les secteurs suivants : 1) les soins de santé de base; 2) la planification familiale et des soins liés à la fonction reproductive; 3) l’alimentation et à la nutrition; 4) la conservation de l’environnement, la prévention de la pollution et le développement des capacités en matière de gestion de l’environnement; 5) l’égalité entre les femmes et les hommes. Le programme comprend également un élément d’engagement du public pour davantage favoriser la sensibilisation au développement au Canada. Un montant de $ 80 622 a été ajouté au montant total pour chaque programme des organisations de coopération volontaire, pour les évaluations de programmes menées par l’ACDI.

column26: PROGRAMME DE COOPÉRATION UNIVERSITAIRE INSTITUTIONNELLE (CUI) MIS EN OEUVRE PAR LE CONSEIL INTERUNIVERSITAIRE FLAMAND (VLAAMSE INTERUNIVERSITAIRE RAAD
column27: Background The IUC partnership with UNALM started on 1 April 2010, after having successfully terminated the pre-partnerprogramme started on 1 October 2008.The partner programme is made of seven multidisciplinary projects gathered around the central theme of Sustainable management of agro-ecosystems and rural development :Cluster 1: Research on sustainable management of agro-ecosystemsProject 1: Farming systems research (5 subprojects)Project 2: Development of value chains for biodiversity conservation and improvement of rural livelihoods (3 subprojects + 1 transversal)Project 3: Agrarian innovation and management of participatory knowledge systems (1 subproject linked to subprojects in P1 and P2)Cluster 2: EducationProject 4: Educational innovation in undergraduate and graduate programs with emphasis on the sustainable management of agro-ecosystems and rural developmentCluster 3: Institutional capacity building and infrastructure development Project 5: Capacity building and infrastructure development of TICS, Library and Language CenterProject 6: Capacity building and infrastructure development of Regional Development Centers (IRDs)Project 7: Institutional change and logistic project supportThe core values of the dominant philosophy of the UNALM s Strategic Plan have been guiding the identification and formulation of this program. These values are: sustainable system, natural resources, food, human interaction and social justice, excellence and flexibility and responsiveness. The UNALM is the official state Agricultural University of Peru; as such it is the only specialized academic institution in Peru that provides higher-level education in disciplines related to Agrarian, Forest, Environmental Engineering, Natural Resource Economics, Food Sciences and Rural Development at the national level. General Objectives Developmental Overall Objective :Improving the food security, the local income, the stability and competitiveness of the agro-ecosystems and thus the overall livelihood situation of the local population through identification and remediation of key agronomic, socio-economic and environmental constraints of small scale family based agriculture in Peru.Academic Overall Objective :Develop, increase, consolidate and internationalize UNALM s academic capacity in research, education, knowledge-transfer and technological innovation in sustainable management of agro-ecosystems to generate leadership in the Peruvian rural sector by maximizing the institutional impact. Specific Objectives UNALM is strengthened in research, education and service to society thanks to the results of 7 multidisciplinary research and institutional projectsP1 : Farming SystemsP2 : Devlopment of Value Chains for biodiversity conservation and improvement of rural livelihoodsP3 : Agrarian Innovation and Management of Participatory Knowledge Systems in the Peruvian Coast and AndesP4 : Educational innovation in undergraduate and graduate progrmas with empha

column25: Women's equality organisations and institutions|Agricultural services |Agricultural financial services|Agricultural co-operatives|General environmental protection, activity unspecified (includes miscellaneous conservation and protection measures not mentioned below) or does not fit under any other applicable codes
column26: LES ASPECTS ÉCONOMIQUES DU DÉVELOPPEMENT DES FILIÈRES AGRICOLES DURABLE
column27: General Objectives Een leefbaar bestaan en structurele versterking van organisaties van familiale boeren en boerinnen in het Zuiden en het Noorden, door een eerlijke toegang tot markten en door ontwikkeling van duurzame land-bouwketens. Specific Objectives Tegen 2013 zijn er duurzame landbouwketens, bij voorkeur op lokaal én regionaal niveau, waarin georganiseerde familiale boeren (zo-wel mannen als vrouwen) met succes de handelsrelaties beïnvloeden (prijs, grondstoffen, machtsverhoudingen, ...) en hun inkomen verbeteren Results R1De productie is beter afgestemd op de markt wat betreft volume, kwaliteit, diversiteit en/of continuïteit en gebeurd meer op een ecologisch verantwoorde wijze.R2Het volume, de kwaliteit en/of de diversiteit van verwerkte producten is toegenomen op een meer efficiënte wijze en met aandacht voor het milieu en de rol van vrouwen in verwerking .R3Een groter volume van producten werd gecommercialiseerd door het aangaan van langdurige contracten met groothandelaars en het aanboren van nieuwe markten die een betere prijs garanderen .R4Meer producten werden verkocht via detailhandelaars en via directe verkoop tussen producent en consument met een certificeringsysteem .R5Er is een betere inter-professionele coördinatie tussen de diverse ketenactoren en financiële en niet-financiële service providers met een sterkere stem van boerenorganisaties.

column2: Développement economique durable et gestion stratégique des ressources naturelles dans les régions de Apurímac, Ayacucho, Huancavelica, Junín et Pasco
column26: DÉVELOPPEMENT ECONOMIQUE DURABLE ET GESTION STRATÉGIQUE DES RESSOURCES NATURELLES DANS LES RÉGIONS DE APURÍMAC, AYACUCHO, HUANCAVELICA, JUNÍN ET PASCO
column27: Background En las zonas de intervención, el Programa permitirá el uso adecuado y sostenible de los recursos naturales (renovables y no renovables), lo que contribuirá a la reducción de la pobreza y a la preservación del patrimonio natural (conservación de la biodiversidad, recursos hídricos sostenibles y alto a la deforestación). Además, la mejora de la producción agrícola orientada al mercado local, junto con la participación positiva de las mujeres, promoverán la seguridad alimentaria y contribuirán a reducir la malnutrición. General Objectives Nivel de pobreza de los hombres y mujeres de las regiones considerados en el ámbito del Programa reducido aprovechando en forma ordenada los recursos naturales y tomando en cuenta las necesidades de las generaciones futuras. Specific Objectives Al 2015, los recursos naturales en el ámbito de influencia del Programa son identificados, valorizados, conservados y utilizados de manera sostenible de acuerdo a una planificación a largo plazo y con una mayor productividad, competitividad y acceso a mercados para los hombres y mujeres que inicialmente vivían en pobreza y extrema pobreza.

column2: Développement des ressources naturelles (MINAM)
column26: DÉVELOPPEMENT DES RESSOURCES NATURELLES (MINAM)
column27: General Objectives La calidad de vida de las poblaciones beneficiarias ha mejorado a través de la conservación y el aprovechiamento sostenible del patrimonio natural Specific Objectives Las capacidades a nivel nacional y regional están fortalecidas para el desarrollo estratégico y puesta en valor del patrimonio natural

column2: Preservation of the biodiversity and sustainable management of the natural resources in the Alto Putumayo area
column26: PRESERVATION OF THE BIODIVERSITY AND SUSTAINABLE MANAGEMENT OF THE NATURAL RESOURCES IN THE ALTO PUTUMAYO AREA
column27: The specific aim of this project is to encourage local Secoya and Kichwa communities to choose a sustainable development model, in view of biodiversity conservation and the sustainable management of the natural resources of the exceptional ecosystem in the Alto Putumayo area. To this end, investments are above all made in building capacity and knowledge around the following themes: internal organisation and strong leadership, administration, status management, drafting of internal regulations, communication, situation of categorisation process ZRG, the preparation of co-management of Reservas Comunales, sustainable management of natural resources and monitoring of territories (in cooperation with ICCA), eco-system services, indigenous rights and rights regarding the extraction of natural resources, and the situation of oil blocks 117A and B, and 187. Secondly, the communities are supported by APP in defending their rights through legal actions and lobbying. APP also supports indigenous federations in obtaining and maintaining their legal status. Expected outcome: 1: Internal organisation and leadership at the level of the communities and both federations are being strengthened.2: There is greater legal security for the communities, their territories and their federations.3: The indigenous peoples know their indigenous rights and their rights regarding the exploitation of natural resources and defend these rights by legal actions and lobbying.4: The indigenous population has been informed of the current state of the categorisation of the Zona Reservada Guëppí (ZRG) and are aware of the central topics of conservation and ecosystem services and joint management of protected natural areas. Document available at https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B-IUzKYaN-QST0RLZGRJa1VXSnM/edit?usp=sharing

column2: Sustainable management to conserve the National Park Yanachaga Chemillén in cooperation wih the management committee and the population in the buffer
column26: SUSTAINABLE MANAGEMENT TO CONSERVE THE NATIONAL PARK YANACHAGA CHEMILLÉN IN COOPERATION WIH THE MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE AND THE POPULATION IN THE BUFFER
column27: This project aims at ensuring the protection of the National Park Yanachaga Chemillén and the sustainable development of families in the buffer zone. It starts with the development of an active and participative management plan of the park, coordinated by the managing organization DRIS (Desarrollo Rural Integral Sustentable). An important assumption is that conservation should be part of a collective consensus en should not be an obligation. Therefor activities are planned concerning the following topics: environment, biodiversity protection and sustainable management of natural resources. The strategy to attain protection and sustainable management is to strengthen the capacities of the direction and administration of the park, together with the management committee and the civil society, through the collective elaboration of projects and productive activities for socio-economic development. The project aims at consolidating an inclusive model for the management of protected areas that allows actors of the civil society and families in the buffer zone to be actively involved in the management of the National Park. Expected outcome: 1. The Directors and the Executive Committee of PNYCH are increasing their management skills in the field of resource management, public use and financial sustainability2. It has an updated master plan with the technical strategy for managing the Yanachaga Chemillén National Park for the next 5 years.3. The families of settlers and natives who have settled in the buffer zone of PNYCH use productive alternatives for the sustainable management of natural resources. Document available at https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B-IUzKYaN-QScEp6TFIxSXRzaTg/edit?usp=sharing
