column26: IMPROVEMENT OF BASIC HEALTH CONDITIONS AND QUALITY OF EDUCATION FOR A HUMAN AND SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT IN LALAQUIZ DISTRICT'S POPULATION (PIURA - PE
column27: Las acciones están dirigidas a la mejora de las condiciones de saneamiento básico y la calidad educativa, todas con un enfoque transversal de equidad de género, sobre la base de 4 resultados: 1) Se construye un sistema de abastecimiento de agua potable en el caserío La Laguna y se ponen los medios para que la población lo haga sostenible; 2) La población mejora conocimientos y prácticas en temas higiénicos, preventivo- sanitarios y conservación del medio ambiente; 3) Se mejora la calidad de la educación pública rural en 3 caseríos del distrito (La Laguna, Papayo y Maray Grande) acercándolos a las nuevas tecnologías; 4) Se visibiliza y fortalece el papel de la mujer en el desarrollo comunal y de la familia, en equidad con el varón. El sistema de abastecimiento de agua potable disminuirá las enfermedades gastrointestinales, además se busca concienciar a mujeres y varones en prácticas sanitarias y ambientales saludables en todos los ámbitos. Se pretende innovar la educación, mediante la novedosa incorporación de tecnologías de la información en las escuelas públicas secundarias del distrito acompañados de un programa de capacitación en computación e informática para docentes y alumnos/as de secundaria. Se fomentará la participación de la población en la conformación de organizaciones capaces del autosostenimiento de los servicios instalados
column50: Multisector aid for basic soc. serv.

column2: Own programme: final year project. Ecological passage in the central jungle of Peru
column25: Formal education/training, Agriculture|Agro-forestry|Natural reserves
column26: OWN PROGRAMME: FINAL YEAR PROJECT. ECOLOGICAL PASSAGE IN THE CENTRAL JUNGLE OF PERU
column27: Desde 1997, la Organización no Gubernamental Aprodes, Asociación Peruana para la Promoción del Desarrollo Sostenible, viene trabajando en la Selva Central del Perú promoviendo el desarrollo rural y el manejo ambientalmente viable en esta región. Una de sus áreas centrales de trabajo es el valle de Chanchamayo. En dicho valle, la deforestación ocasionada por la agricultura migratoria de subsistencia es uno de los problemas más graves, y ha afectado las cabeceras de las cuencas y las formaciones de bosque montano existentes en muchas localizaciones. El presente proyecto presenta diferentes objetivos, siendo estos los siguientes: Crear 100 Km de corredores ecológicos entre el Bosque de Puyu Sacha, el Santuario nacional Pampa Hermosa y el Fundo Génova (propiedad de la Universidad Nacional Agraria La Molina) con la intención de contrarrestar la fragmentación de los hábitats. Mejorar la situación socioeconómica de los agricultores del distrito de San Ramón, mediante la aportación de capacitaciones, material para el cultivo del café, asesoría técnica, etc. Potenciar la agroforestería como método de cultivo sostenible en la zona. Las prácticas se han llevado a cabo conjuntamente con el equipo técnico del proyecto, siempre dirigidas y coordinadas por el director de éste. Durante el trascurso del periodo de prácticas se han llevado a cabo tres tareas esenciales para el desarrollo del proyecto: Elaboración del mapa de idoneidad Realización de la bitácora de registro de cuatro especies forestales del bosque de Puyu Sacha Capacitación al personal técnico sobre el uso del GPS Como conclusiones del proyecto, resaltar la magnífica idea de capacitar a los agricultores en la aplicación de la agroforestería en sus parcelas de cultivo. Este nuevo método que se quiere aplicar es de especial interés por su compatibilidad con el medio ambiente, y no solo ayuda a mantener la ecología del lugar, sino que también sirve para mejorar la zona en el ámbito socioeconómico.
column61: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank

column2: Project: Impacts of the oil activity on the animals (subsistence hunting) and the health of the Achuar and the Quitxu
column21: GENERAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION|Mineral resources and mining
column25: Mineral extraction and processing, infrastructure, technology, economics, safety and environment management|Environmental impact assessments
column26: PROJECT: IMPACTS OF THE OIL ACTIVITY ON THE ANIMALS (SUBSISTENCE HUNTING) AND THE HEALTH OF THE ACHUAR AND THE QUITXU
column27: En las últimas décadas, las actividades petroleras en la Amazonia peruana han generado severos daños sobre el ecosistema donde viven las comunidades indígenas Achuar y Quitxua, y existen indicios de presencia de contaminantes en concentraciones peligrosas para la población local. Este proyecto tiene como objetivo evaluar el impacto de la contaminación petrolera sobre la fauna cinegètica, de tal forma que se determine si, en las condiciones actuales, se puede considerar que la caza de subsistencia, principal actividad para las comunidades locales, es una fuente de exposición a la contaminación petrolera para la población indígena debido a la ingesta de crudo (por la confusión entre salitrales naturales y derramamientos de crudo). El proyecto pretende continuar con la sistematización de la información recogida sobre los impactos generados por las actividades hidrocarburíferes a la región. Se recolectaran y analizarán muestras de tejido orgánico y excrementos de la fauna cazada a las comunidades para determinar el contenido en hidrocarburos y la bioacumulación de metales pesados.
column61: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank

column26: 10-CO1-048/PROSALUS/BOLIVIA AND PERU/TOTAL INITIAL 5,42M€/NUTRITIONAL FOOD SECURITY
column27: 10-CO1-048/PROSALUS/Bolivia y Perú/$total inicial 5,42m?/Seguridad Alimentaria Nutricional La presente propuesta de Convenio pretende consolidar, profundizar y ext ender los logros de seis de los principales procesos de desarrollo que P rosalus impulsa en Perú y Bolivia, orientados al efectivo ejercicio de l os derechos humanos a la salud,a la alimentación y al agua. Para ello, s e integran en un sólo programa las seis intervenciones para, desde este enfoque basado en derechos, dar continuidad al trabajo de incidencia en los determinantes de la salud de las comunidades de intervención, especi almente la deficiente alimentación y la desnutrición, que tiene un impac to sobre la salud y desarrollo vital de las personas, por lo que las int ervenciones persiguen garantizar la Seguridad Alimentaria Nutricional, c on enfoque de Soberanía, promoviendo la equidad de género, la sostenibil idad ambiental, la participación activa de la población en la construcci ón y control social de las políticas públicas relacionadas, reforzando l a gobernabilidad local y fomentando mayor implicación de las autoridades en el desarrollo rural (clave para la sostenibilidad y replicabilidad d e las iniciativas implementadas). Todas las intervenciones se llevan a c abo en ámbito rural, en comunidades campesinas andinas situadas a gran a ltura, con condiciones climatológicas adversas y alejadas de los centros de provisión de servicios. Para aprovechar el potencial sinérgico entre las seis acciones, Prosalus ejercerá un rol facilitador de procesos de reflexión estratégica y operativa, fomentando el debate sobre la estrate gia de intervención al interior del Convenio con una visión global y en base a la experiencia en otros países, confiriendo cohesión a través de, entre otras actividades conjuntas, intercambios de experiencias y accio nes deincidencia en políticas públicas de soberanía alimentaria y salud.

column26: AUSTRALIAN LEADERSHIP AWARDS - FELLOWSHIPS 2013
column27: Through the Australia Awards Scholarships Australia offers a range of study and professional development opportunities (including long-term awards) to promote sustainable development. The overarching goals of the Australia Awards Scholarships are to: achieve country and regional program development outcomes through strengthened individual and institutional skills and knowledge; support leadership; and support Australia's broader foreign policy agenda through long-term linkages and partnerships. They provide long and short term study and professional development opportunities to citizens from developing countries around the globe. The total value of this multi-country initiative is $347.6 million over 8 years, starting 2012-13.

The project will develop locally adapted technical and socio-economic criteria, methods as well as a monitoring system for the compensation payments.

column2: ACA Regional REDD Policy CFI 2010-12

column2: Recycling center of Cuna Nazareth
column26: RECYCLING CENTER OF CUNA NAZARETH
column27: The project establishes a recycling centre and trains unemployed young people to be professionals in recycling in Pachacamac poor outskirts of Lima. The aim is to create a training system for recycling. The established centre sells material to industry and repaired items at low price to people in the area. The purpose is to make the centre self-sustaining during the project and to make profit in the future. The project also aims to improve environmental awareness of the people in Pachacamac.

column2: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
column26: LOCAL COOPERATION FUND (LCF) IN PERU
column27: They are already working in the proposed matter in the area which has become most threatened with the construction of the new inter oceanic highway. The beneficiaries of the project are people who are already settled there. The purpose of the project is to strength their actual management of the area enhancing their engagement with already running environmentally friendly activities. This would not only improve their economic returns but also limit the possibility of deforestation by the action of new comers over abandoned lands.

column2: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
column26: LOCAL COOPERATION FUND (LCF) IN PERU
column27: Participative conservation and sustainable use of the orchid Phragmipedia kovachii endemic species of Amazonas & San Martin regions (North Western Amazonia of Peru).Continuation of a former project seeking to save the species from extinction and help to preserve the whole forest in the area (a natural reserve threatened by extractive activities of surrounding population) through the involvement of local people by offering to them the possibility of getting monetary incomes from eco tourism and in vitro cultivation of the endangered orchid. This last support will allow them to implement the recommendations of a marketing study meant to assure the future sustainability of the new activities proposed to local people and to provide some additional equipment to the centre of interpretation and rangers' post for it to serve as lodging facility for future tourists and researchers.

column2: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
column26: LOCAL COOPERATION FUND (LCF) IN PERU
column27: Alleviating the deforestation pressure in the buffer zones of both Cordillera Escalera Regional Natural Reserve and Cordillera Azul National Park through the promotion of sustainable management of two native palms for the production of vegetal ivory and brooms. The communities are already involved in the extraction of non wooden forestry products with good commercial demand which will give them a source of incomes alternative to logging or deforesting for introducing livestock. This phase will allow them to start giving added value to their production/ San Martin (North Eastern Amazonia)

column2: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru
column26: LOCAL COOPERATION FUND (LCF) IN PERU
column27: Specialized training for natural reserves' rangers and exchange of experiences among them as well as organizational consolidation of their professional association throughout a national congress of rangers. The training will include: guidelines to face climate change effects on their working areas; national policy for environmental education; sharing experiences on eradication of illicit crops; sharing experiences on eco tourism; biology as a tool for conservancy; management of natural reserves; patrolling and control of poaching and illegal logging.

column2: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Peru

Regional Government. They have showed most convincing reasons for expecting the sustainability of the project's results.

column26: GREEN GROWTH IMPLEMENTATION - PERU
column27: GGGI is currently supporting CNC (National Council for Competitiveness by its Spanish acronym) in the development of inputs of the Competitiveness Agenda 2014-2018 in the areas of water and sanitation, and the environment in general. In addition, GGGI and CNC have mutually identified an interest in expanding our support in 2014 to develop a framework to mainstream the incorporation of green growth concepts and goals in national and sectoral planning documents. - Environmental policy and administrative management

column2: Support to the Climate Change Agenda, III
column26: SUPPORT TO THE CLIMATE CHANGE AGENDA, III
column27: This third programmatic loan program will help consolidate a series of policy measures aimed at strengthening the legal and institutional framework which encompasses public institutions with roles related to climate change. The operation¿s components are: i) Macroeconomic Stability; ii) Institutional Framework; iii) the Mitigation Agenda; and, iv) the Adaptation Agenda.

column2: Support to the strengthening of regional capacity for climate change management
column26: SUPPORT TO THE STRENGTHENING OF REGIONAL CAPACITY FOR CLIMATE CHANGE MANAGEMENT
column27: The following technical cooperation seeks to support regional governments to overcome difficulties in the conformation of the Regional Climate Change Strategies. Additionally it will support MINAM in the supervision and follow-up of the strategies.

column2: Implementation of adaptation measures in four watersheds
column26: IMPLEMENTATION OF ADAPTATION MEASURES IN FOUR WATERSHEDS
column27: This technical cooperation will support the 'Dirección de Cambio Climático, Desertificación y Recursos Hídricos' of the Ministry of Environment -MINAM-, in the preparation and execution of pilot adaptation measures.

column2: Support to the Climate Change Unit within the MEF
column26: SUPPORT TO THE CLIMATE CHANGE UNIT WITHIN THE MEF
column27: This technical cooperation will strengthen MEF's Climate Change Strategy.

column2: REDD pilot projects with local communities in the 3 regions of Peruvian Amazon
column26: REDD PILOT PROJECTS WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN THE 3 REGIONS OF PERUVIAN AMAZON
column27: To implement activities in order to reduce the emissions from deforestation and degradation of forests (REDD) to mitigate the process of deforestation caused by the development of transportation infrastructure in three regions of the Peruvian Amazon.

column2: Adaptation to Climate Change of the Fishery Sector and Marine-Coastal Ecosystem
column26: ADAPTATION TO CLIMATE CHANGE OF THE FISHERY SECTOR AND MARINE-COASTAL ECOSYSTEM
column27: The approach of the proposal is to focus the adaptation measures in two pilot areas, one associated to the southern tip of the Tropical Eastern Pacific Coastal Ecosystem, and the other one, a typical representative of the Peruvian Coastal Upwelling Ecosystem (PCUE). In the selected pilot areas the project will create the regulatory framework for the local fisheries community to play a major role in the management of a given ¿area of exploitation¿; strengthen the community to execute its role as main partners in the management; develop a group of productive activities to enhance the income of the associated fishing community, also providing alternative livelihoods; implement a monitoring and applied research component seeking to develop an early-warning information platform and the know-how required for the sustainable exploitation of the selected environmental services; and develop the regulation, policy and administrative capacity to create the enabling environment for the fishing communities effective management of the selected 'area of exploitation'. the ultimate purpose of the proposal is that these adaptive measures at local level can be upscaled or replicated to other zones of the coastal domain, combining governance, capacity building and interventions sponsored by the government and the private sector.
